newsitem.title: CANADA: TVX Gold sells US$250 million notes.
newsitem.headline: TVX Gold sells US$250 million notes.

text.p: TVX Gold Inc said on Monday it completed the sale to a group of underwriters of an aggregate of US$250 million of Gold Linked Convertible Notes bearing interest at five percent a year, payable semi-annually and due March 28, 2002.

TVX said upon maturity of the notes, TVX will pay in respect of each US$1,000 of notes an amount equal to the greater of US$1,000 or US$1,000 multiplied by an amount determined with reference to the increase, if any, in the price of gold valued prior to maturity over a reference price of US$362.15 per ounce.
TVX said it may also satisfy its obligation by the issue of its common shares instead of payable in cash.

Proceeds of the offering will be used to repay certain indebtedness, including US$150 million of 7.51 percent senior unsecured notes and for general corporate purposes including capital expenditures and for the acquisition, exploration and development of mining prospects, TVX said.
